instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
Unit came is as dead, no light on magsafe
Found smc shorted, and pp3v42_g3h 8.7V
replaced SMC, U7090,R7095,R7096. and now get orange light on charger.
Still does not boot.
RTC voltage and pch signal all good but missing pm_slp_sus_l. This needed for pm_slp_ s5_l signal? or dead CPU

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_S5 now?
Post exact PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H voltage.

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN - 3.4
PM_BATLOW_L - 3.3
PCH_DSWVRMEN 2.6v - Diode mode 0.796
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.4

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
All these look good.
Post now all PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
PCH_SRTCRST_L -  3.3
PCH_INTVRMEN - 1.8 / 3.3
PCH_INTRUDER_L. -1.8 / 3.3
SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1 - 32KHz on o-scope

but i find the reading abit inconsistant in the sense sometimes i get low reading about 1.8V for INTVRMEN and INTRUDER but when reconnect magsafe it goes to 3.3.

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
Steady 3.3V at PPVRTC_G3H?
PCH_INTVRMEN and PCH_INTRUDER_L are influenced by voltmeter impedance; measured voltage can drop until 2.4V.
These signals cannot drop under 2.1V, or the machine will not work properly.

threads.title: A1466 00165 missing pm_slp_s5_L
threads.message:
yes steady.
I used the o-scope and got consistent 3.3v from it. bye bye CPU
